title: Lake Superior
description: "Niedecker [is] one of the most important and original poets of this past century."—August Kleinzahler, London Review of BooksLake Superior is a compilation of writings around Lorine Niedecker's poem of the same title—strata that inform the poem's ecological and historical resonance.From "Lake Superior Country":Every bit of you is a bit of the earth . . .So—here we go. Maybe as rocks and I pass each other I could say how-do-you-do to an agate.Lorine Niedecker was a major American poet often connected with the Objectivists. She lived in Wisconsin from 1903 to 1970.
author: Lorine Niedecker
